channel.title: First cape model! :O
channel.description:
ok well as i said im not going to post every model i make which im not because this is like the 4th model i made today and it was my first cape model so i thought i should post it to see if im any good at making capes.. and yes i know messy wire frames and stuff but come on first cape i might improve it later :P
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/cape.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/wireframefront.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/side-1.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/capeotherside.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/capeback.jpg[/img]
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/capeonnpc.jpg[/img]
also i was thinking about making it into a set with some other models i had made acouple weeks ago..
[IMG]http://i1183.photobucket.com/albums/x470/0acer0/armourset.jpg[/img]
should i finish the set?
p.s i know its a simple model with no prims but i was only testing out how to make a cape so please dont go on about no prims and saying im not listening because there are other models im working on that involvs prims and all that other stuff :)

@amy_webb1 wrote:

h1 sk1ller:

Ok you seem to be a crazy and wild modeller, keep on going but please don’t post EVERY single model here >> I am sure you can tell which ones look better and which ones don’t.

i havnt posted every model i have like a billion others sitting in my folder and they shell stay there >: ) anyways… i assume one looks better then the other but then i port it i get a different response

Read full topic

item.title: First cape model! :O
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

[quote=“kingman002, post:16, topic:379132”][quote author=amy_webb link=topic=474982.msg3473662#msg3473662 date=1295491682]

That doesn’t really look like a cape… But actually it’s pretty good for a first time.

its like a shoulder/cape thing i dono which one i should of named it after but hey… first time doing the shoulder too

Good god that wireframe is terrible. Need to work on your poly flow.

as i said the wireframe is messy and also as i said… its my first model that involvs a cape and shoulder so of corse it isnt going to be the best… but i am thinking of a way to make the cape without it being messy so

if your cape could be animated good cause they cape goes on ur arms o.O well i like it, not so much the wep and shield

so i take it not to do the set?
[/quote]
its your choice and id love to see how it turns out but im thinking it wont be good, but i say go for it, so we can all see how it turns out, btw, is that kiteshield made all out of prims?[/quote]

uhh… nope it was like my 3-4tj model… i cant remember and i cant put it in game because for some weird reason my models never work ingame -.-…

Read full topic

item.title: First cape model! :O
item.dc:creator: @kingman002 kingman002
item.description:
@kingman002 wrote:

[quote=“amy_webb, post:5, topic:379132”][quote author=someone2 link=topic=474982.msg3473249#msg3473249 date=1295467422]
That doesn’t really look like a cape… But actually it’s pretty good for a first time.
[/quote]

its like a shoulder/cape thing i dono which one i should of named it after but hey… first time doing the shoulder too

Good god that wireframe is terrible. Need to work on your poly flow.

as i said the wireframe is messy and also as i said… its my first model that involvs a cape and shoulder so of corse it isnt going to be the best… but i am thinking of a way to make the cape without it being messy so

if your cape could be animated good cause they cape goes on ur arms o.O well i like it, not so much the wep and shield

so i take it not to do the set?[/quote]
its your choice and id love to see how it turns out but im thinking it wont be good, but i say go for it, so we can all see how it turns out, btw, is that kiteshield made all out of prims?

Read full topic

item.title: First cape model! :O
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

the wanderer:

A lot better, but I would segment that cape up a bit for when it is animated. You subdivide areas that will move. Almost like joints. If this were ever to go on a game.

yer i was thinking about moving it up and making the front part closer to the neck but i had some other things to finish off

Read full topic

item.title: First cape model! :O
item.dc:creator: @amy_webb1 amy_webb
item.description:
@amy_webb1 wrote:

Cole1497:

I honestly was expecting a skillcape recolor (I didn’t read who the OP was when I saw the topic with [NEW!] labeled on it), so I suppose that bad mood being lifted is making me think a bit better of the model. The poly flow is pretty bad, but the concept is nice. When making things black, lower the ambiance, and raise the color in the V area from 0 to about 5. That way it doesn’t look papery and gray.

i know if yo udidnt see the set attempt its full dark black i just forgot to do it ebfore i started taking pics lol

Read full topic

item.title: First cape model! :O
item.dc:creator: @Cole1497 Cole1497
item.description:
@Cole1497 wrote:

I honestly was expecting a skillcape recolor (I didn’t read who the OP was when I saw the topic with [NEW!] labeled on it), so I suppose that bad mood being lifted is making me think a bit better of the model. The poly flow is pretty bad, but the concept is nice. When making things black, lower the ambiance, and raise the color in the V area from 0 to about 5. That way it doesn’t look papery and gray.

Read full topic
